item.title: Rs2006 site hacked
item.description:
@202685 wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:34, topic:439503”]You have no idea how many people have pointed out fact #2 and were flamed “Go back to rs2012 2k12 prod”.

Idk what that even means. :o[/quote]

2k12… 2k = 2000 and the 12 = 12… so 2k12 = 2012 by default… prod is “A verbalization that encourages you to attempt something” or whatever u can find here http://www.audioenglish.net/dictionary/prod.htm

Read full topic

item.title: Rs2006 site hacked
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

drubrkletern:

People who usually say that are the faggots who try and fit in and hop on the old days bandwagon who dont know shit about it and they themselves are 2k12 prod fags

I know, I started just part or maybe around 377, so 317 is a mystery to me (though I made an account around 317 I never logged on until I figured out how to resize the game), but I enjoyed it more than almost any revision, 459 being my favorite oldschool, and 562 being my favorite higher revision.

item.title: Rs2006 site hacked
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

I never had faith in the project, so many kids were like “amggggg best serbar eva guys!!!”, when in reality, they’ve made so little progress compared to other projects that we’ve had had. (I don’t mean the amount done, but the rate at witch most of it was added)
Sure, their code may be much more professional, but what matters is that it actually works, not how clean and tidy the source code that only a select handful of individuals will ever see is. Another problem is that I never heard any plans to develop it further after they complete it. They should at least lead it off to their own game with unique content rather than sit there and soak up cash off it.

Lastly, the little kids that followed this would’ve hatted this. The reason most people loved RS was because

  1. We were kids
  2. This was like a whole new world, and it was one of the first kind of things were you have to literally find out everything on your own on a large scale. It was like a massive puzzle, that today most have solved, and no matter the revision it will still be redundant unless more content is added.

Read full topic
